story:
Once upon a time, in a land filled with love and light, there was a kind and gentle princess named Lily. Princess Lily lived in a beautiful castle with her mother, the queen, and her father, the king. She spent her days playing in the gardens, learning about the kingdom, and helping those in need.

One day, while Princess Lily was out for a walk in the forest, she came across a small, scared bird with a broken wing. She gently picked up the bird and cradled it in her hands. She knew she needed to find help for the bird, so she carefully carried it back to the castle.

When she arrived, she went straight to the castle's wise old healer, who examined the bird and told Princess Lily that it would need time and care to heal. Princess Lily was determined to help the bird get better, and she spent every moment she could tending to the bird's needs.

Days turned into weeks, and slowly but surely, the bird's wing began to heal. Princess Lily was overjoyed to see the bird flying around her room, healthy and happy once again. She knew that her love and care had made all the difference for the little bird.

From that day on, Princess Lily made it her mission to help all the creatures in her kingdom, no matter how big or how small. She spent her days tending to animals, healing their wounds, and showing them love and compassion.

And so, Princess Lily became known throughout the land as the kindest and most compassionate princess who had ever lived. People from all over the kingdom came to see her and to seek her help, and she never turned anyone away.

Princess Lily's love for all creatures became a shining example for everyone in the kingdom. And even long after she became queen, her legacy of kindness and compassion lived on, inspiring generations to come.

As Princess Lily tucked the little bird into its nest that night, she whispered a prayer of thanks to God for the opportunity to help and to serve. And with a heart full of love and gratitude, she drifted off to sleep, dreaming of all the ways she could make a difference in the world.

And so, my dear daughter, as you drift off to sleep tonight, remember the story of Princess Lily and the little bird. Be like Princess Lily and always show love and kindness to all creatures, big and small. And know that God is always with you, watching over you and guiding you as you grow and learn. Goodnight, my dear, sweet child. I love you more than words can say.
